meanings.definition: A porous, absorbent material used for cleaning or applying liquid substances.
meanings.sent1: I used a sponge to clean the dishes after dinner.
meanings.sent2: The kitchen sponge soaked up all the spilled juice.
meanings.sent3: The sponge was so thirsty, it drank up all the water in the sink!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a sponge, absorbing every word the teacher said.
meanings.sent5: The sponge's ability to absorb water amazed the scientist.

meanings.definition: A type of simple aquatic animal with a porous body.
meanings.sent1: The sea sponge is a fascinating creature found in the ocean.
meanings.sent2: Sponges in the sea come in various shapes and sizes.
meanings.sent3: The sponge in the aquarium seemed to be enjoying the underwater view.
meanings.sent4: She felt as relaxed as a sponge floating in the calm ocean.
meanings.sent5: The sponge's gentle movements in the water were mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.definition: To clean or wipe with a sponge.
meanings.sent1: She sponges the table to remove the spilled milk.
meanings.sent2: He always sponges the car to keep it shiny and clean.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to sponge the muddy pawprints off the floor.
meanings.sent4: He sponged away the dust, revealing a shiny surface underneath.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully sponged the excess paint to create a beautiful texture.
